args: Um...h-how do you know my name?
It IS you! Oh, thank heavens\nno one else found you first.
I must apologize for the increased security.\nThings have been a bit—
Th-they know! About the plan to elope,\nI mean. I...heard a guard outside talking\nabout it earlier.
But if you knew, why did you come inside?\nThere's no point in trading letters when the\nplan has already been found out!
That wasn't for me to decide;\nthis letter belongs to you.
...Oh, I can almost see his smile as I read\nhis words. He always was a hopeful fool.
But now our future will never be,\nand it's all my fault.
I don't even know how to tell him...
Th-that's okay! I'll write him back!
I've actually come up with a plan.
*nod* And if it works, you and Remuel\nshould be able to meet up! ...Um, in the\nopen, I mean. Whenever you want.
How is such a thing possible?!
It's a whole bunch of old letters I found—\nletters between your dad and Remuel's.
THOSE two wrote each other letters?!\nIt staggers the imagination.
Y-yeah, and it seems like they used to be\nreally close before something came\nbetween them...
So if, um... If we can fix that, we might be\nable to stop this whole feud thing!
At which point, they would have no reason\nto oppose our relationship...
Oh, this is wonderful. If it really works,\nit would change EVERYTHING!
But how do we go about doing that,\nexactly? They pretty much hate each other.
Reading their correspondence, I, um...\nnoticed something: There was no reason\nfor them to have fought in the first place.
I think it was all just a misunderstanding.
The next day, at the ball...
Father, you have a guest waiting in the\ndrawing room. It seems they have a\nsensitive matter to discuss?
Um...I set it up. I asked Julia and Remuel\nto bring you here.
I, um... I just needed to find out what\nmade a pair of old friends drift apart\nwhen they used to be...pen pals.
So you know of the letters, eh? How?!
I...read them. In a storage closet.
YOU! YOU are the rat who's been breaking\ninto my home to deliver those damnable\nmissives to my daughter!
You are nothing but a base criminal,\nand I will see you hanged for this!
Father, stop! Just LISTEN to her!
This feud you're clinging to all may have\nstarted as a simple misunderstanding!
This letter here is, um...\nfrom Remuel's father.
See how there's a page missing?
I'm a m-messenger, so I always make\nsure to count the pages in a letter.\nIt's...part of the job.
'Cause, um, I don't want it to be\nout of order or...something.
I suppose I don't pay overmuch attention\nto such things when reading my mail.
But even so, a fellow can tell when a PAGE\nis missing! It would leave a jump in text!\nA gap in the language!
Y-yes, that's... Normally, that's true.\nBut this letter just happened to line up.
So, um, if you take the end of page one\nand the start of page three, it reads,\n＂You remind me of...moldy cheese.＂
Oh yes, I remember that quite well.\n...But wait. Are you saying that ISN'T\nwhat the letter originally said?
But that means the scathing reply I sent...
Oh, I recall THAT one well! Quite shocking,\nactually, to open a letter from a friend and\nfind a firestorm of invective.

I asked what I'd done to merit such a
tirade, but you only replied with still
further abuse—and a snide remark
about week-old bleu, if I recall.
At that point, I was seeing red myself,\nso I drafted a letter cutting off all ties\nand threw it in your face.
From that moment on, it was war.
Y-you see? All of this was just a...\na misreading of a letter.
So, um, do you think you can reconcile\nwith one another and see it in your\nhearts to accept Julia and Remuel's love?
Hmm. Even knowing the cause, a man's\nfeelings don't just change in a moment.
Indeed not. We've been at it for so long,\nand this isn't the sort of divide one can\nbridge overnight.
Instead, it will take work and dedication—\nas well as communication between our\ntwo families.
V-very well. If he is willing to accept this...\nI suppose I am as well.
Oh, thank you, Father! Thank you!\nRemuel, did you hear that?!
I can scarcely believe it, Julia!
We owe our future to you, Noelle!
Oh! Um, I mean... I didn't really...
I'm just glad that you and Remuel...er,\nand both of your fathers have managed to\nreconnect.
(It's hard to get feelings across when you\nspeak—or even when you write a letter.)
(But that's why I'll never stop running...\nSo I can make sure people are connected!)
